intro: Lippia cuneifolia, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green foliage and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is often used in herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for garden use in warm climates.
